english: tree; to plant; to set up; to establish

etymology.description: semantic: 木 'tree' + phonetic: 尌 ('to plant a tree'); simplified: 壴 → 又
etymology.interpretation: 木 provides the meaning domain of wood/trees, while 尌 contributes the sound and is itself related to planting. In the simplified form, the complex 壴 inside the phonetic component was replaced by 又 to reduce strokes while retaining recognizability.
etymology.simplification: Component 壴 in the phonetic 尌 was replaced by 又 to lower stroke count while keeping 木 on the left for meaning.

examples.chinese: 我们在公园里种树(我們在公園裡種樹)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài gōngyuán lǐ zhòng shù.
examples.english: We plant trees in the park.

examples.chinese: 学校门口的老树被保护起来了(學校門口的老樹被保護起來了)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxiào ménkǒu de lǎo shù bèi bǎohù qǐlái le.
examples.english: The old tree at the school gate has been protected.

examples.chinese: 公司要树立良好的形象(公司要樹立良好的形象)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī yào shùlì liánghǎo de xíngxiàng.
examples.english: The company needs to establish a good image.
